attributes.comment:
As adoptive parents, who have paid fees to the US government to adopt an
international orphan, and who may go through the process again we find it highly
disturbing that the fees are being raised. And, with the given that many parents
must go through the process and pay fees TWICE while waiting for their dossier
to be processed overseas these additional fees become even more obscene. It
becomes even more upsetting when you read that the increase in fees is to
provide services to some asylum cases and others at no charge. If the USCIS is
in need of additional funding, then raise the fees for ONLY the ones attempting
to immigrate here (not adopted minors). And as for those who are provided
services at no charge, if it is of benefit to all Americans then the cost should
be paid by all Americans (i.e. funded through the federal budgeting process) not
paid by the small percentage of Americans who happen to adopt an orphaned child
form overseas. This huge increase in fees by a governmental agency is uncalled
for. Especially in this time of the public demanding that government be held
more accountable for the resources it has.
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by Adoptive Parents, Frank and Allyson Moore
